description: Advance contract award notice (ACAN) is a public notice informing the supplier community that a department or agency intends to award a contract for goods, services, or construction work to a pre-selected supplier, which allows the other suppliers to express their interest in bidding by presenting a statement of capabilities. If none of the suppliers present a statement of capabilities that meets the requirements set out in the ACAN, the contracting officer can proceed to award the contract to the pre-selected supplier.

## Title
Training Day of Ethnocultural Structured Learning
## Reference Number
cb-429-49070819
## Solicitation Number
21301-24-4578441
## Tender Closing Date
Tuesday, December 4, 2023 at 2:00 p.m. EST

## Background
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is seeking a contractor to deliver a one-day training session on ethnocultural awareness for parole officers, their managers, and Indigenous community development officers (ICDOs). The training aim is to enhance the understanding of the legal requirements for taking ethnocultural aspects into account, specifically for Black offenders.

## Objectives
- Provide training for 400 employees, comprising 19 sessions of 7.5 hours each, with a variety of regional locations and virtual training sessions.
- Offer culturally sensitive approach, integrating historical and cultural background of Black offenders.
- Develop the ability to recognize cultural differences and form effective relationships with diverse individuals.

## Tasks
- Deliver 3 virtual training sessions via Microsoft Teams.
- Offer training between 8:30 a.m. and 4:30 p.m., with breaks.
- Use own equipment to deliver training.
- Provide detailed training content to the Project Authority, at least 15 days prior to the first session.

## Eligibility
To be eligible, contractors must demonstrate a minimum of two years of experience delivering training to professionals, with specific experience working with adult delinquent Black clientele. They must have provided professional services as an expert or counsellor to professionals working with adult delinquent Black clientele, a minimum of 60 days within the past two years.

## Presentation of Statements of Capabilities
Any supplier interested in this opportunity may submit a statement of capabilities detailing their qualifications by December 4, 2023, by 2:00 p.m. (EST).

## Contract Details
- The contract is for approximately four months.
- Estimated value is $50,000 (GST/HST not included).
- The contractor selected will meet the requirements and will be followed by subsequent contract award.

## Contact
Kim Lavallée, Acting Regional Supply and Contract Officer, Correctional Service of Canada / Service correctionnel Canada.
